intro: Phoradendron tonduzii, commonly known as the Tonduzii mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on a variety of host trees, primarily in the neotropical regions. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and is characterized by its leafless stems and small, fleshy berries that contain sticky seeds. The plant lacks true leaves and relies on its host for water and nutrients, while performing photosynthesis through its green stems. It plays a significant ecological role in its habitat by providing food for birds and insects. Its presence can influence the health and structure of the host tree.
